title: Microphone Stopped working after iPadOS 14.6
text:
All my Apple apps work (voice memo, video and Siri). However, since I updated the my iPad Pro to 14.6, the microphone stopped working in teams, and every other non Apple vendor application. 

I was reading that the new ‚Äútracking‚Äù might have something to do with the problem. It‚Äôs obviously not a hardware error, and I‚Äôm sure it‚Äôs a Apple IOS hidden setting or bug. My teams still works on my iPhones, so it‚Äôs probably just the iPad Pro 11‚Äù 2nd Gen.  My privacy setting is enabled for the microphone. 

Please fix either Microsoft or Apple. I‚Äôm sure you will each blame the other.

title: It‚Äôs great- work on MFA
text:
While the application itself works fine, and many new and useful features have been added over the past two years, there is still room for improvement. 

I find it frustrating that sometimes MFA -via MSFT Authenticator in my case- can take several attempts before you are authenticated into your app. My issue is that FaceID is constantly checked, 3-5 times, until finally ‚ÄúSecuring your app‚Ä¶‚Äù is displayed. I‚Äôve noticed this isn‚Äôt so much of an issue if I open Microsoft Authenticator FIRST and THEN go into Teams (a new instance of Teams, not switching back to an open instance). 

Other than that, keep up the good work!

title: Live subtitle for people who need it?
text:
We are heavily rely on teams for our meetings, and me as a none native speaker found the live subtitle really helpful. But recently notice that this function is unebled by organizer, because if one person in the team turn on that function, it shows up for everyone and somebody find it not so comfortable or self conscious. 

So.. It is possible that we show a icon to acknowledge the team that someone is using the live subtitle instead of broadcast the substitute to everyone? I believe you guys have better solutions to make this inclusive tool more usable!

title: Worst app doesn‚Äôt even compare with the others
text: As the title reads this app is just horrendous to use and for what I‚Äôm using it for is even worse. First when put in team and doing assignments on mobile and turning them in then logging in on a desktop all the data get lost somehow and I end up having to do it again. Secondly I can‚Äôt even get in a conference call with everyone because there‚Äôs no button to allow me and when sent an invite by the host it immediately kicks me off the app and I have to redo everything. Third it‚Äôs really hard to just navigate like it wasn‚Äôt made to be user friendly and I really hate it. This app is so much worse then google classroom it‚Äôs not even funny. Devs step your game up this app is complete trash. If I could give it a lower rating I would but sadly Apple doesn‚Äôt allow negative criticism on their app store üëéüèºüëéüèºüëéüèºüëéüèºüëéüèº

title: Do Not Use
text:
I downloaded this app.. I really was looking forward to using this. I think it will be a great tool for my business. But there is a problem, if you make a error in your set up, such as your Company Name or anything else, you will basically have to delete the account and set up an entire new account which will put your business at risk and starting all over... 

My concern is, if I decide to use this apps for the next several years and i build my entire business around it and if I notice an error I possibly made or a colleague error, I would potentially loose everything and force to start all over because Microsoft claim there is no work around in fixing it unless I purchase a full subscription... to me, this is a scam.... I‚Äôm looking for other options now and will not be using it... Maybe Apple will have something in place

title: PDF Documents and pictures
text:
Hi, 

So when I‚Äôm connected as a guest on a conference call, I can‚Äôt attach a pdf file more than once, yes it happens and that‚Äôs weird. I suggest strongly to put the a way that we can choose the media we want to select not just one thind (Media) when you hit on media it takes you straight to your pictures without asking you again if you wann go to files or studio pictures or Onedrive. Please make selections specific and clear. For example: when I press Attach it should shows some options like photo/Document all the time. Or make documents a separated button from media so we can go quickly and show documents in the meeting without getting late.

title: Good but intrusive call logs
text:
This app generally works well for its intended purpose.  The calendar function is great and you can easily use it without syncing your personal calendar. Like many Microsoft products, the default configuration makes some interesting choices so you need to play around to find some options.

I would have given this 5 stars, but there is an oversight that MS has been aware of for two years but has not fixed.  If you use its calling feature (incoming or outgoing), it will add the calls to your phone history making it clog the iPhone history with junk. It‚Äôs especially uncool considering Teams does not have as sophisticated of a caller ID as iOS. Spam calls galore!

title: Methodology
text:
The app is great, I believe there‚Äôs room for improvements with templating. MS Teams may incorporate a ‚Äúghost like‚Äù image on each page/software selection of what the information could look like and benefit an organization. Coming up with creative ideas to display and coordinate data without some guide or capability is and has taken a great deal of time and stress when command wants info and a running system soonest. 

The software (ppt, word, excel) has been difficult to update using Teams. Blurry images of the work, different methods to write updates using Teams makes it better to just download the item, complete the update, and upload changes documents back into teams.

title: Doesn‚Äôt work well with AirPods
text: Teams has been a great app for supporting collaboration during these unprecedented times. My only gripe with Teams is that it doesn‚Äôt work well with AirPods. For example if I receive a call on Teams while my AirPods are still in their case, removing them from the case to use them on the call gives mixed results. Sometimes the audio will play over my iPad speakers even though the iPad recognizes my AirPods and shows that they are connected. Also sometimes the audio will cut out completely on both the speakers and my AirPods and I will need to hang up and call the person back. Reliable AirPods compatibility would make this a 5 star app for me.

title: Good and getting better
text: My company has implemented Office 365, so I chose to standardize on Teams as a one stop place for my team for communications. I like how you can integrate so many different apps for project management. I also like how Incan get notifications or communicate easily on any device quickly using the Teams apps. The only issue is discovering more ways to use teams effectively such as best practice. I have also noticed that sometimes connecting or network issues are a problem. Overall I think it is a nice product that appears to be getting better. They just need to work more on connectivity issues, although some could be related to individual networks.

title: Notifications barely audible
text:
We are using Teams for a chat within our organization. We have been frustrated that there is no ability to change the volume or type of notification tone on iOS devices. Sometimes on a check comes through there is no sound or notification at all. When there is a sound it‚Äôs barely audible. Would be great to increase the volume of the notification.

This is a known issue and is discussed on Microsoft forums without a fix yet. It would be great if it uses the same volume as standard iMessage notification. 

To the other reviewer who is having trouble getting the badge to go away, there is a Setting for temporary verses persisted notifications which might help.

title: Utter Garbage
text:
The Pinnacle of Microsoft development mentality of "we'll tell the user what they want" instead of listening. WHY is this app this buggy this far in? Missing messages? Constant app lockups? Changing audio devices like bluetooth causing minute long audio drop outs? UI "features" you can't turn off like the new meeting window HOVERING OVER EVERYTHING even when I leave the app? Oh don't want it? Have a permanent arrow in the corner you can keep accidentally clicking trying to use another app. God forbid Microsoft actually put options in a menu to let someone customize to their liking. No. Microsoft "KNOWS" what you want, just like they know you want to use Edge and Bing

Why do meetings KEEP opening picture in picture when I leave the app when it's DISABLED for the whole iphone? Microsoft UI is laughably terrible

title: Great until‚Ä¶
text:
Despite keeping up to date on my iOS and the Teams app updates, I still experience network drops on this app alone. I don‚Äôt experience it on Zoom, for example. 

It‚Äôs getting very old, and after resetting my network, ie, forgetting it and logging in fresh, the problem has only gotten worse. It starts at around 15 minutes into a video chat. 

Seems like a cache or memory or bandwidth problem, but the throttle is clearly with the app. I had out IT examine our WiFi and internet to confirm. Others in the office experience this as well. There is a closed Microsoft thread where they were looking at hardware used, but ultimately there is no solution there either.

title: Has potential...but falls flat
text: This app is decent. That‚Äôs the only way I can describe it. There‚Äôs SO MANY bugs, it‚Äôs a huge swarm. Almost every time I join a meeting, I get stuck in the waiting room, except I can hear everything!!! It‚Äôs so annoying. The meetings are laggy, the chats get glitched when you use two devices, sometimes the posts don‚Äôt go through...you get my point. This app is very very very frustrating. I‚Äôve asked other people, and they have the same problems as myself. If there were much less bugs, this app would get a better rating. Unfortunately that‚Äôs not the case, and this deserves one star. And I‚Äôm sure they have the tools to fix it but they just don‚Äôt want to so people get the one where you have to pay money. I‚Äôm sure that one‚Äôs just fine. So yes, I do not like Teams, I‚Äôm sick of it.

title: So many bugsüíÄ
text:
I have had this app for a few months due to work and its the most bugged up app I have ever dealt with. I can‚Äôt open the app via a notification because it just starts glitching and trying to reload every other second.

It rarely updates comments/notifications correctly. On my phone it will say its been hours since I‚Äôv last posted something when in reality I‚Äôv posted multiple times since then. I also have issues with it when using a computer as well. Forget going to correct a comment that you‚Äôre trying to type out because it randomly decide to erase over letters as you retype instead of just typing in between.

I also know I am not the only one who has issues with this app either. Many of my coworkers don‚Äôt get any notifications (yes, their notifications are turned on in both the app and their phones settings) at all.

I am quite stunned that this app has such a high rating with so many crappy issues that haven‚Äôt been fixed and like I said, I have had and used it for months now and nothing has been updated or fixed.

We are now planning to switch to a more efficient work communication app because of this.

title: Alerts don‚Äôt always work
text: I actually do love this app but many of my colleagues and I do not receive alerts on our phones.  We won‚Äôt see messages until we actually open the app, or we‚Äôll see them on our lock screen but will not have received an audible or haptic notification. This seems to be pretty widespread for some time now. A corporate messaging system that does not alert you promptly is extremely frustrating and can make you look bad, especially in today‚Äôs remote workforce. Please address this ASAP Microsoft. Thanks in advance.

title: Current version crashes when using dictation
text:
Good luck trying to report a bug to Microsoft, their site just gives you the runaround. I just wanted to report that the current version of Teams for iOS gets completely screwed up if you try to use dictation to transcribe a message, then hit send. The messages won‚Äôt go through, and the chat window will go completely blank.

I‚Äôve been having to restart my phone to get it to work again, however the last two times required me to uninstall and reinstall it. It works fine if you don‚Äôt use dictation, but sometimes when I‚Äôm in a hurry it‚Äôs just easier to do it that way.

Either way, it should work as expected. Hopefully they‚Äôll fix this bug soon, just be careful anyone who likes to use dictation.

title: Faulty Notifications and Call Windows
text: I‚Äôve had teams on my phone for over a year due to COVID, and the app is *awful*. At some points I had to uninstall from my phone it was such a nuisance. It frequently rings me for calls that I‚Äôm not actually getting from people‚Äî I had three of these ‚Äòfalse calls‚Äô this morning an hour before work even started. When you do pick up calls sometimes the icon in the top left showing you‚Äôre in an active call won‚Äôt go away even if you hard close out of the app. It‚Äôs so frustrating to never REALLY be sure whether the call is over and to have the call icon flashing green incessantly. It shocks me that there‚Äôs so many invasive and disruptive bugs in an app by a company like Microsoft. I would 100% delete it if my workplace did not rely on it so heavily.

title: Great, but lots of bugs
text: I‚Äôm a student who uses Teams every day for learning. I really like it, but sometimes it doesn‚Äôt respond and closes. Other than that it is great. It keeps me organized with each of my classes having different teams and allowing each of my teachers to assign different things and have them all listed on one platform. I have 2 ideas on how to improve the platform. The first one is to make it so we [, the students,] can filter assignments by the due date and so that we can pin certain posts and people and go to our pinned section to find them faster. Microsoft Teams is great!

title: Apple Watch alerts are a huge benefit!
text: Typically I wouldn‚Äôt write a review on a software for work, but this app has been a huge benefit while working remotely the past 9 months. The team can easily stay connected. We hold all internal meetings through Teams. The sound and video quality are excellent! My favorite function is that the app sends alerts to my Apple Watch for new messages if I stepped away. This alerts me if there is something important to return back to. I have loved the app and the desktop application. I‚Äôm glad my company made the switch to Teams from Skype for business long before COVID hit.

title: Several updates need to be made
text:
On a computer, I love Teams. I am using it as a teacher for my 150+ students to finish out the year. However, when I am not at my computer, the app is the most frustrating thing to use. I cannot upload files to my teams. I cannot create announcements instead of just a message on the team. I cannot do a ‚ÄúMeet Now‚Äù with any of my kids on my iPad. I just wish all of the features on the computer were available on the app. It really can‚Äôt be that difficult. 

Overall, the app is useable for chatting and joining meetings, but for using it as my primary device, definitely not. I hope this can be updated soon so I don‚Äôt have to drag my monster of a laptop from my district around any time I want to sit outside or go on a trip and work.

title: Just copy Slack
text:
Please adopt Slack‚Äôs feature of allowing grouping of chats. You currently only allow 15 chats to be pinned & for leaders with teams that are larger than 15 people that means someone‚Äôs messages on that team are likely to go unseen. 

In larger organizations it is also key to have the ability to group messages by departments, teams, etc. This allows the more important messages to hav greater visibility. 

Your ‚Äúpinning 15 messages‚Äù feature rather than allowing for grouping link Slack does honestly just feels like an old outdated company he has not caught up to improved methods of organization & feels like Microsoft just doesn‚Äôt care to fix things because it already has a large enough market share. That usually does not end up working out well for companies when they do that as we‚Äôve seen with other dinosaur companies that eventually go away because they didn‚Äôt think they needed to improve. 

That feature needed to be updated months ago. It wasn‚Äôt so please update it now. 

Sharing as a user of Microsoft who likes some of your apps like Outlook & ‚ÄúTo Do‚Äù & hopes you fix this so we don‚Äôt have to change services for our company.

title: Not refreshing well
text:
2 months ago the app worked flawlessly. Ever since some of the recent updates were applied, refreshing the view is inconsistent. Have to constantly close out of app and reopen to see new messages. 
I actually missed messages from colleagues yesterday as I used the app on my phone for on call support and had consistently checked for new notifications until by my surprise all popped up this morning from yesterday. I have configured the settings for background app refresh on iPhone. I am using iPhone XR with phenomenal wifi connectivity. 
Hoping devs will see this and apply fixes to help w refreshing and real time messaging, thank you

title: NOTIFICATIONS
text: I have shifts scheduled for 14 days straight and due to the dynamic nature of my work I‚Äôm sometimes on call very early in the morning, way earlier than my scheduled shift. I have quiet hours set until 8am in Teams and ‚Äúshift‚Äù notifications turned off in ‚ÄúGeneral Activity‚Äù, but I sporadically get a notification that my shift is starting in an hour. It‚Äôs seemingly random. It‚Äôll be quiet for several days and then notify me, then quiet for several more days, and notify me again. The app is quite good aside from that. Wish I could select more than one photo at a time when uploading photos from specific albums in my phone.

title: Teams is easy to use for collaboration between groups across IT platforms
text: We use Teams at my company so we can communicate across different IT platforms easily.  We create the different groups and can add people so everyone can be aware.  It is very easy to use my only drawback from using it for at least over a year is it is very ‚Äúbuggy‚Äù on start up. Don‚Äôt put it in your Start up menu, start it up later once other programs are already up. We are looking into other apps for collaboration and for Agile but this is pretty great! Lots of great features: live chat, chat which saves history, access to files, communication to your whole team, etc.

title: needs a prompt before calls are made
text:
Overall the Teams app is useful way to stay connected while not at your laptop. However there needs to be improvements on the calls function. It‚Äôs too easy to accidentally call out when on the calls tab. This is especially frustrating when you were on a group call and have to apologize to multiple people.  This can be remedied by including a prompt like iPhone has. Also it would be great if Teams phone numbers could receive and send SMS texts

I‚Äôm want to use the Teams call functionality as it easy to have one number for clients and colleagues.  Please add these functionalities soon!!

title: Best Team Collaboration Application
text: I loved Teams even before last year when we started working remotely. My team though was not engaged wity it. It was too new and they could not see the advantage of it. After we closed the office and went remote, it became one of the major ways our team and the others teams in the organization stayed connected and took our work and collaboration to a whole different level. There‚Äôs still so much more we can use it for and I will be leading the team on how we can use it and love it! Thank you Microsoft!!!

title: Useless for Sharing Hand-Writing Screen
text:
I‚Äôd like to share some slides on PC and make discussion with hand-writing using my iPad app with an Apple Pencil in meetings, but I found Teams is totally useless for my purpose.
First, desktop app cannot share the iPad screen connected to the PC. So, the iPad itself must be connected to internet even you are sitting in front of a networked PC, and you need to log in again. Second, you cannot share the whiteboard with guest users outside your organization. This feature has not implemented for a long time. Third, screen sharing has not work after mid-October, 2020. I guess it is caused by the problem with iPadOS 14 and I found the same issue reports in the Microsoft support site; but this critical problem has not solved.
I suggest Zoom and WebEx are much smart if you plan to share the hand-writing screen.

title: Good product, meets the need for Team comm.
text:
In terms of the app, works great to make sure I get notified of Team communication.  In terms of the overall product, I selected Teams for my company because it had better out-of-the-box features than its primary competitor, and integrates nicely with Microsoft 365 license management.  So, onboarding becomes fairly hassle free.

Compared with pure chat tools, a team focused tool like this is nice since it keeps it to just your team (i.e. no spam).

However, while we use Teams for ad-hoc calls and chat, which is what it‚Äôs good at, we are continuing to use Zoom for all company meetings (since COVID).  Teams still has a way to go to match Zoom in that regard.

title: Idea for teams
text: I really like teams, it‚Äôs what we use at my school but there‚Äôs one thing I don‚Äôt like which is when we go to assignments you have to click on each class to see if you have an assignment for it or not. You should have two areas ‚ÄúNo Assignments‚Äù and ‚ÄúAssignments‚Äù when we click on Assignments on the bottom of our screen there should be ‚ÄúAssignments‚Äù on the top with all the classes that we have assignments due under it, and under that should be ‚ÄúNo Assignments‚Äù with all the classes that we have nothing due for them under it. Overall just would like to see that change

title: Some Issues
text: Sometimes a meeting will be started and some of of the participants won‚Äôt be able to see the meeting at all. For example: history class: Before you open the history team, you see the video icon, meaning there‚Äôs a call/meeting in progress. Once the team is clicked, there‚Äôs no meeting. Other participants have been able to join, and they have no issues but some don‚Äôt see the meeting at all. The chat for the meeting will pop up once those in the call start using it but even still, the meeting isn‚Äôt showing up. I missed an hour of class because of this and all I can hope for is that it‚Äôs not the same on Monday.

title: Feedback noise
text:
In the beginning there were no problems with feedback noise I have been using it since March.  Over the last couple of weeks there has been several different noises within our meeting.  Feedback noise when others are talking, echo and a loud noise sound like a buzz.
Not able to stop the noise when ending call and starting over had to wait until it stopped on its own.  Feedback noise was for an entire meeting which made it hard to understand and hear.  Literally read her lips while she was speaking. 
Outside of that it‚Äôs easy to use and I like being able to share my screen, record meetings and use the chat.

title: A great app
text: I got this app when I got windows 11 and decided to install it on my phone and it‚Äôs great. The interface is very simple and easy to use everything is pretty straightforward. The only thing that I‚Äôm not a fan of is that the other person has to have teams installed on their device to message or call back. I think you should be able to use it like sms and text/call without needing the other person to have the app. It‚Äôs not a real problem but just a little feature suggestion for future updates.

title: Great work app, horribly slow
text:
I love this app. I used Slack for work before but this app is really a lot better. The organization of channels, chats, threads is better synced with the work experience. Also the extra applications are great for productivity within Teams.

The only problem, and it is a big one, is connectivity and speed. The app works awful with a slow and semi slow internet connection and it‚Äôs interface is really slow, when I try to find something in the chat history it takes A LOT of time to pull the old messages. When using connectors or tabs is the same thing, those extras load SO slow we refrain from using them. Although the app has so much power, we don‚Äôt use much of it because of this speed problem. I hope it gets solved SOON!

title: Great features with limitations
text:
The Teams platform is really great if you can stay tethered to a desk or the device you‚Äôre on. Would be great if users can hot switch devices mid call from desktop to mobile app and vice versa. Many soft phones do this already and have for a long time. Sometimes I‚Äôll be into something and then have to go do an action away from my desk and have to put the call down making communication less efficient and causing multiple trips.

Screen share, file share, video, group calls and messaging, integrations all great.

title: Software issue and lack of support options
text:
MS teams started bugging out on February 8th, not getting past the loading screen. Uninstalled and re installed to fix the issue.
February 9th same issue again freezing at loading screen. Trying to get to app support after signing in online shows I‚Äôm 311 in line for live chat but if I switch out from the screen I can lose my place..

Really Microsoft? I know you‚Äôre one of the largest companies in the world but you guys have really sub par customer service. No email, didn‚Äôt get a call option, no hassle Free customer service... you guys can really take a page from apple or PayPal on customer service at least I could leave a message with them and they will get back to me when possible without me having to tie up my phone/computer and wait for support.

title: ew.
text: I have to use this for school. Currently, the "join" button for you know, joining the freaking call,  is not showing up on my laptop, pc, or iPhone. It's so glitchy, there's only a few name icons/people visible on the screen at a time, when you try to look at the (probably at least 20) other people in the meeting, they're literally in an unclickable button icon at the bottom left of the screen that'll say something like 25+. It's not even more secure than zoom, my schools teams got hacked and kids got into meetings and started screaming profanities. If teams decides to stop working, you just have to live with it. It's so poorly designed, and it hasn't improved  like at all since the beginning of COVID-19. You would think Microsoft would clean this dumpster fire up, but no, they went ahead and just rearranged office 365 again.

title: Great For Work at Home
text: Great communication app, it makes connecting with me coworkers so much easier especially since we are working from home! I‚Äôve never worked from home but this has certainly made it easier you can call, message, share you computer screens so they can follow along as you go and you can create different chats to fit your specific needs, whether it‚Äôs working at home, owning your own business and communicating with your employees, or even doing over the phone interviews! Definitely would recommend to others as a team communication platform!

title: Comparatively Crappy
text:
First thing I notice is that Teams does not offer an Apple Watch app for calendar notifications. Second, the form feels blocky and does not have a smooth flow. Just your basic chat functionality. Missing lots of features that seem rudimentary nowadays. Third is the fact that Microsoft forced the installation on all windows workstations, with default startup function and you cannot seem to remove it because it keeps reinstalling itself. 
Maybe people don‚Äôt want to use it because it is crap. Maybe they should implement a developer and customer feedback process to improve Teams before forcing it upon people.
I would be willing to give it a higher rating if it actually kept up with much smaller and much better team chat products.

title: Indispensable for a remote workforce!
text: So glad that my office rolled out Teams prior to the COVID-19 home lockdowns!  It is a wonderful tool for keeping remote teams in touch.  And it‚Äôs powerful too... we‚Äôve had Team video meetings with 20+ participants, used the share screen feature, and the video and audio streams were flawless!  Create channels for everything you work on!  You‚Äôll be amazed by how connected your office can be while locked away in our separate homes!  Using this application is like using two monitors for the first time... you‚Äôll never be able to go back to how you were working before!

title: Teams App
text: Great tool but missing features.  Perhaps these missing features are simply because teams hasn‚Äôt advanced (matured) yet.  A couple of things missing:  a global list of folks without having to search.  This would allow to quickly scan who‚Äôs available rather than searching for someone first.  The org hierarchy is a great feature for those mid size and smaller companies.  Because of the org hierarchy we now utilize the active directory structure.  The problem is their isn‚Äôt an org hierarchy entry screen and the only way to access it is from a previously selected person.

title: Lacks visual flexibility
text: My use for this app is to be able to remotely join office meetings when I can‚Äôt attend in person. The host sends a video & audio feed for everyone using Teams. I could not find a way to make the video full screen. Instead I get a bunch of icon boxes of others that joined the meeting on Teams rather than have them on a hide-able list. If they are simply watching/listening, they each shouldn‚Äôt be taking up as much screen space as the host‚Äôs video feed. I looked through all the options & settings I could find but there was nothing to make one person‚Äôs video go full-screen. Using the largest iPad there is the little video window is way too small. That makes this app useless for those that need to see visual presentations.

title: Really like Teams for Work!
text: I really enjoy teams for using at work it is super helpful for video meetings and talking with other staff. I use it daily both remote and on site, has really helped during COVID and with staff working from home. The only thing that I‚Äôm still trying to find out if possible is to have the reminder for a meeting annoy me until I acknowledge it. I can only figure out how to get one alert and if I am not near my phone and then open my phone without looking at the alert on Lock Screen I miss the alert.

title: Unnecessary permissions required to work
text:
If you want to make a call, it requires access to scan your local network devices and refuses to work if you deny that permission. There is absolutely no reason this should be required and Microsoft is basically holding your call ability hostage unless you allow them access to scan your local devices (which allows them more access to your private data). As an iOS dev, I know exactly what this permission allows and know it should not be a requirement for any video calls so is either lazy developers or is them using this to get around user privacy features of iOS. Either way should be a red flag.

Also you can‚Äôt lower the volume all the way off. They REQUIRE you to have your sound on. What utter garbage.

title: Schedule
text: So when you have multiple groups sharing schedules in the same team, it can really get hectic if people aren‚Äôt careful enough to turn on their filter. When you start to see that you have 819 scheduling conflicts, you know someone is updating schedules and rather than sharing it with affected members only, they share with the entire team and they copy their schedules and they don‚Äôt have their filter turned on. Other than that as far as collaborative work meetings chats sharing files, teams is an excellent way to achieve group input simultaneously. It is an excellent program

title: Pretty good but not perfect ‚Äî phone and multi tasking can be improved
text: If you‚Äôre on a call and want to respond to a different chat you can‚Äôt go back to the chat function unless someone writes to you. Similarly, the phone is glitchy and there are sound issues quite frequently. Perhaps most importantly, the documents that are uploaded and shared in a chat aren‚Äôt easily retrievable. They disappear from the chat ‚Äî the file tab is pretty useless because it never shows the uploaded documents. Very problematic, it is not a safe repository. Otherwise pretty good, but can (and I‚Äôm sure will) be improved.

title: MS Teams - Still some work to do
text: I have been using MS Teams for about 2.5 years now for work. I enjoy many of the features but for meetings, it is not always reliable. I have had plenty of connectivity issues when trying to have a video call/meeting. Also, it is frustrating that MS Teams does not play well with Apple ear pods. I am always mobile and wear my apple ear pods. I love that all teams chats are announced in my earpods to keep in the loop. However, the audio does not connect when I join a Teams call from a mobile device, this is very frustrating as I usually end up losing the connection and have to redial in and use speaker on iphone.

title: Ages!
text: I‚Äôve been asking for this format for meetings for years. I‚Äôm so glad those of us who work nights have the opportunity to participate in these dayshift meetings. Especially when I work the night before and then work the night of‚Ä¶. it‚Äôs my in between shift.  I cannot stay an extra 2 Hours, drive home, fall asleep, wake up, and then come back to work. So this has been so helpful this year and last year. It has to be the most I‚Äôve ever participated in meetings because usually they do fall on days where I‚Äôm working.

title: Teams Application is Amazing
text: The teams applications is an amazing alternative to about 5 other collaborative apps all in one! We‚Äôve been encouraging folks to use it within our IT department at my company, and we love it so far. Once I found out it was free I‚Äôve been recommending it to everyone I know. Way to actually build something the way humans actually want it for a change Microsoft! You guys are starting to get it together again I think. I always think that and then you come out with some Windows 8 equivalent nightmare. So don‚Äôt take a big Vista in your pants, and try to keep it up.

title: Great but have to chance.
text:
I use this app to study while there is quarantine, and there are some problems:
- The turn in button is so hard to see, try to make it bigger and it‚Äôs better if you can place the button next to file we‚Äôd uploaded (like when you finish upload the file to give it to your teacher, you can clearly see the turn in button immediately, so you don‚Äôt have to find it anymore)
-The video is lag sometimes, athough my wifi is very strong.
-I use Ipad to connect to the app and I figure out that I can‚Äôt see the chat when I‚Äôm calling. If I want to see the comment, I have to click to the icon in the right-top of the screen. And after that I can‚Äôt see my friend faces. It little noisy. So try to make it work like what you do on computer. When I can chat and see my friend faces both.
By the way, I think it is a good app to use.
Edit: I‚Äôm not an English speaker and so do my friends, so my English is not good, but please try to understand it and maybe you can improve the app. Thanks.
